I simply must say ONE more thing about April Ryan's question to President Trump, "Mr. President, are you a racist?"  I would like to ask April Ryan one question: Were you not listening the many, many times that Donald Trump said OVER AND OVER AGAIN that he was not a racist.  The reason why this is a foolish question is that April already had the answer.  She had heard it many times already.  Sunday Omony, you just said yourself that you remember Donald Trump saying that he was the least racist person that you will ever meet, and you are not even a reporter.  Surely April Ryan, being the excellent reporter you say she is, already had the answer to her question...in fact, she surely has heard Donald Trump say many, many times that he was the least racist person you will ever meet.  What was the point in asking that insinuating, reprehensible question in the first place.  Now you may not want to admit it, but everyone knows (I think) that April Ryan was just trying to make the atmosphere unpleasant for the president.  The main thing I am saying is that it is STUPID to think that President Trump is going to reply to April's question, "Yes, April, I am a racist."  Even if he is a racist, any IDIOT should know that he is not going to admit it.

To me, this question was a senseless, dead-end question: "Mr. President, ARE YOU A RACIST?"" makes as much common sense as spitting your food out into your plate, then putting it back into your mouth and chewing it up again.  "Mr. President, are you a racist?"  What did April Ryan expect him to reply?  Did she expect Mr. Trump to turn around and answer, "Yes, Ms. April Ryan, I am a racist."   Is that what she, or anyone else, really expected?  I tell you, that will NEVER happen, and everybody has common sense enough to know it.  This is why it was a senseless, pointless, empty, waste-of-time, foolish question.  I ask you: Did anyone really expect President Trump to turn around and say before all the world, "YES, Ms. April Ryan, I AM A RACIST!"  Come on.  Let's use a little COMMON SENSE. April may be a well-known reporter, but that was one of the most "unplugged-in," foolish questions I have ever heard.  Now here's the naked fact, which everyone of good conscience will have to agree with me:  Instead of April Ryan asking the question "Mr. President, ARE YOU a racist?" I believe she actually wanted to make the statement, "Mr. President, YOU ARE a racist!"
